intro: Polygala theezans, commonly known as the Zanzibar milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 meter, featuring woody stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, yellowish-green flowers that bloom from October to December. It is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
